byline.contributor: William Neuman and Azam Ahmed reported from Mexico City, and Randal C. Archibold from New York. Paulina Villegas contributed reporting from Almoloya de Juárez, Mexico, and Yadira Solano from Mexico City.
byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN, RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD and AZAM AHMED

abstract: Prison escape of Mexico's notorious drug kingpin Joaquin Guzman Loera damages Pres Enrique Pena Nieto's image as reformer; many Mexicans are questioning how much credibility he has left with his vow to stamp out ills of past.
lead_paragraph: The breakout of the drug lord Joaquín Guzmán Loera shattered President Enrique Peña Nieto’s pledge to break with the corruption and incompetence of the past, and led Mexicans to question his government’s effectiveness.

headline.main: Mexico Prison Break by ‘El Chapo’ Is a Blow to President Peña Nieto
headline.print_headline: Kingpin’s Escape Is a Blow to Mexico’s Leader

snippet: The breakout of the drug lord Joaquín Guzmán Loera shattered President Enrique Peña Nieto’s pledge to break with the corruption and incompetence of the past, and led Mexicans to question his government’s effectiveness.
